author: suburbandad_
content:
Regarding EL sync post-merge, it seems to me that EL's should be able to use a recent finalized block as a pivot for world state, but also as the root for a backward sync of the blockchain.

Is there any reason an EL could not simply download the pivot block, prioritize syncing the world state, and be "up"?  Then EL could import the rest of the blockchain backward from the initial pivot block.

author: suburbandad_
content: it seems like this would be the strategy to support sync post eip-4444

author: suburbandad_
content: talking with <@680337202521440470> , for this to be a viable strategy all of our pivots blocks would have be finalized. (or at least the final pivot block would have to be finalized).  Otherwise we could end up with a world state that is isolated on a fork, unable to reorg to the canonical chain.

author: suburbandad_
content: I believe that is the case in-general post-merge, not just if we want to backward sync the blockchain
